fields.description: We have a number of releases that run concurrently.  I have not been able to find a way to get the system have the components change based on the selection of the release.  For example if I select release 2.0.0, there may be componets 1, 2 and 3.  Release 2.1.0 might have the same components plus another.  In release 2.0.0 there are the engineers a, b, and c, while in release 2.1.0 engineers d, e and f.  What I would like to have the system allow this relationship definition.  I have not found that yet and did a search of the outsanding requests - perhaps I missed it.  What I have done to simulate this is create different projects.
fields.summary: Selection of release should change components and assigned engineer

fields.description: It would be nice to have the Full Name Contains filter, as in Create Issue -> Reporter -> User Picker , on the Administration -> User Browser.  More often than not  we know the user's name but not his/her email address and quite often the user does not have an email address at all.  So right now we go through this cumbersome process of going to the User Picker, entering the name, finding the username , entering the ViewUser url with username manually.  If there's an easier, existing way to do this, I sure would like to know.  Thanks.
fields.summary: Add "Full Name Contains" to Administration User Browser

fields.description:
If user A performs an action that changes a workflow, but user B changes the workflow before user A submits their change, when user A eventually performs the action they will recieve the 'Workflow Changed' error screen. Any comments made by user A will be completely unrecoverable and must be rewritten from memory. 

'Workflow Changed' error screen should always output any submitted comment text so that the user can salvage their work from the error screen. The current workaround is to copy the comment text prior to posting.
fields.summary: Post submitted comment text on 'Workflow Changed' error screen
Subscribe/schedule a report to run and email the results

fields.description: Ensure that the systeminfo and 500 pages show the external user managment option.  The user and groups statistics on the sytem info page should also show a note stating that the statistics may be incorrect if external user management is enabled.
fields.summary: Add external user managment property to system info and 500 page

fields.description: Add a check to groupnames.jsp to disable the form when external user management is enabled.
fields.summary: Check for external user management in groupnames.jsp

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12248].
  {panel}

It would be neat if issue links:

1. Could do a bulk change in the context of browsing the parent issue. I realize there is a custom script that allows child issues to take on the status of the parent, but sometimes we want to change them by hand to a different status. Or maybe only change some of them at one time.

2. In the issue navigator, it would be good to have 'Links' be a sortable column.

3. When displaying the issue links of a parent, it says:

This issue <italics>links to issue...<italics>.

The italics part is taken from the link type, though the 'This issue' part seems to be canned. It would be neat if the 'This issue' part of the text was replaced by the actual issue type it's referring to. I think it's rare that anyone will have an issue that's actually called 'issue'. Folks might have bugs, enhancements, tasks, etc.


Thanks!


-Matt
fields.summary: Improvements to issue linking

fields.description: This issue is a place holder for all the Crowd integration issues we want to fix in JIRA for 3.8.
fields.summary: Crowd integration support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12244].
  {panel}

In our JIRA implementation editing of issues is only allowed for privileged users who don't need to justify why they're making a change.  We have a lot of fields on our edit screen and even with tabs it's a bit cluttered.  We'd like to be able to nix the comment field on the edit screen to save a bit of screen real estate and clutter.  A drop-down on the Edit for a screen to enable or disable the comment field would be nice...  it could even be combined with http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-4972 to a single drop-down as follows:

Comments:

Disabled (Ability To Leave Comment Does Not Appear On Screen)
Enabled And Not Required (Comment Is Optional)
Enabled And Required (User Must Leave Comment)
fields.summary: Allow control of whether comment field will be shown on Edit and Transition screens

fields.description:
Backup path is not setup during the setup wizard. Ways to reproduce this bug:

1) During the setup wizard, set the backup path
2) Login as an administrator
3) Go to the Administration -> System -> Services
4) The path for the backup service is not set
fields.summary: Backup path not set by setup wizard

fields.description:
Jira needs sub-components, sub-projects, products, or suites.

A product suite is composed of several projects.  A project can be included in multiple product suites.  A product suite has versions and each suite version is tied to specific versions of its contained projects.  For example Suite 5.2 might contain AppX 1.2, Core 10.4.1, and CoreUtils 9.3.1.

I believe that the product category concept could be extended to behave more like a suite.  Add versions to categories, allow a project to be in multiple categories at once, and then allow linking of "suite" versions to specific project versions.

Alternatively, just allowing n-level nesting of projects would do the trick and would eliminate the need for components altogether (as noted in JRA-846).
fields.summary: Support for Product Suites / Sub-Projects

fields.description:
It would be useful to be able to display only the relevant version number when an issue is fixed in multiple versions, but some of them are not yet released.  A typical example is where an issue is fixed in an earlier maintenance version (2.1.15) and also in the next new feature release (2.3.1), but the fix cannot anymore be applied backwards for the versions 2.2.1 and 2.2.2, since they have already been released.

We have a list for product managers and internal users with information about the next versions and recent history and would like to be able to show only the relevant version number on each list like this:  2.1.15 for the history and 2.3.1 for the next version, now we have both numbers on both lists for the same issue which is a bit confusing. 

We are using the Show Saved Filter Select Columns and an option like "Show only filter-specific version numbers" for this when creating the filter would help.

PS. Why do I actually have to make a released version to get the "Released Versions"-filter option? Is that fixed in the latest version? Otherwise it would be a nice enhancement along with making it possible to filter multiple modules using Unreleased/Released Version-filtering.
fields.summary: Option for how to display unrelevant version numbers when using Unreleased or Released version filtering

fields.description:
The page:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/i18n.html
talks about choosing a default language as well as creating a new translation for JIRA.

There is too much information on this page.

I think everything after the "Creating a new translatiion of JIRA" title should go into the JIRA space on Confluence, as the information is more meant for develoeprs/extenders of JIRA.

We should probably link from the JIRA docs page to the new Confluence page and the other way around.
fields.summary: Move the Create New Translation JIRA doc to confluence

fields.description:
When JIRA auto-links issue keys (eg. JRA-122119), it uses the base URL. This causes problems when JIRA is available from multiple URLs, eg. http://company.example.com/jira and http://internalserver.

Rather than using the base URL, we should infer the URL from the request.
fields.summary: Don't use base URL in issue auto-linking

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12206].
  {panel}

In 3.7, JIRA has two links on the search results page for RSS:

RSS  ( Issues  | Comments  ) 

The problem with simply linking is that the user doesn't get a chance to specify:
 - what they want back - issues, comments - why not both?
 -  what authentication type they want (defaults to none - usually not correct - see [docs|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/navigatorviews.html#Accessing+protected+data])
 - what maximum results they want (defaults to 1000 to stop crawlers killing JIRA with huge searches - frequently unexpected)


Instead, JIRA should have an RSS feed builder, like Confluence. What to get back (issues, comments, worklogs, etc) should be checkboxes, so users can get exactly what they want, and authentication should default to BASIC, since most people's issues are protected by a permission scheme.
fields.summary: JIRA needs an RSS feed builder to specify max results, authentication etc

fields.description: The Create or Comment Handler on support.atlassian.com does not seem to be setting the issue security level to the default (Reporters and Developers only which is the Default).  This is not an issue there, as the default permission scheme protects customers from seeing each others issues anyways, but it should be looked at.

fields.description:
If you have 'createusers=true' entered as a Mail Service parameter, and JIRA receives an e-mail with an invalid "from:" field (for example, a mail client dumping the persons name in there instead of an e-mail address) JIRA will go ahead and create a user with an invalid e-mail address field.

A further problem is that JIRA will then attempt to send the newly created user a password e-mail, resulting in the following stacktrace:

fields.description:
Currently CachingProjectComponentStore caches component ids to ProjectComponents and ProjectComponents contain its GenericValue representation as well. 

However this generic value representation is *before* the write to the database and does not necessarily reflect the generic value *after* the write to the database.
This becaomes obvious and erroneous in databases such as oracle which treats empty strings as NULL. JRA-12193 - Ensures components are not created with any empty string values, however this brings inconsistencies within the CachingProjectComponentStore, as the generic value within a cached ProjectComponent object will have NULL but the value inside the ProjectComponent will be an empty string.
fields.summary: Ensure CachingProjectComponentStore caches the same values as the database

For instance, for each user I would be able to set up an IM account at which user with the account

fields.description:
Need to improve the document for [hiding fields|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/issuefield_configuration.html#hidefield]

Currently, the description appears to say the same thing twice and fails to document the vital difference between hiding the field and removing it from all screens.

Hiding a field from the [field configuration|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/issuefield_configuration.html] page will make JIRA think that the field does not exist for the associated project, hence it is not shown on any associated screens and the fields *default value is not set*.

Whereas if you remove the field from all the associated screens, it will not show the field on any of the associated screens but the fields *default value is set* as JIRA knows about it.

I think having some kind of matrix will help explain it better:
Eg. The following table describes the behaviour of a field depending on whether the field is
* Shown/Hidden on the [field configuration|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/issuefield_configuration.html]
* Required/Optional on the [field configuration|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/issuefield_configuration.html]
* On/Off an associated [screen|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/fieldscreens.html]
|| Field Visibility / Requirement || Required || Optional ||
|| Show & on screen | Field value is required and must be selected/entered | Field value is optional - can have no input selected/entered |
|| Show & off screen | Uses default value if it has one, otherwise causes 'field value required' error | Uses default value if it has one, otherwise stores no value |
|| Hide | Field is ignored and stores no value| FIeld is Ignored and stores no value|
fields.summary: Improve doc on hiding fields

fields.description:
When selecting the "update" button in the "edit" screen, the selected component is reset.  After that, the link between the bug and the component is lost.  The version field does not have the same problem.  Setting the component again later works fine, but once it is set, next time you edit the bug, it disappears again.

I found this issue using a customized workflow, where a status transition shows the "edit" screen.  I am able to reproduce it to using the "edit" operation on a brand new default installation, so I think the bug is appearing wherever the "edit" action is referenced.
However, I have defined projects where this does not occur, I was not able to find the reason why.

Steps to reproduce:
- start a brand new default installation of Jira 3.7.3, with an empty database
- create a default project names "Test" with key "TST" and project lead "root", all other settings are default
- create a component named "C1"
- enter a new issue, and select component "C1" to log the issue against
- select the "edit the issue" operation
- update the issue without changing anything
- the component will be reset to nothing
fields.summary: "Edit issue" resets the assigned component

Errors

fields.summary: Wrong selection when using "Group Custom Field Value" while custimzing a Notification Scheme

fields.description:
We're running multiple, diverse projects with separate permission schemes such that those with jira accounts can see only those projects for which they have permissions (and any projects with world-readable elements). No one in any of the groups associated with a particular project has global jira-administrators privileges, though the small, central, jira-administrators group  does have admin and browse permission in all permission schemes.
The project leads of the various projects have varying needs as regards workflows, notification schemes, etc. As it is now, the central jira-administrators group needs to create workflows/notification schemes and assign them to the various projects. As far as I can tell, there is no way to delegate workflow/notification creation and editing to any person or group other than jira-administrators. Since jira-administrators creates the scheme and then assigns it to a project, it seems, on the face of it, reasonable to be able to allow project leads/project admin groups to create their own workflows/workflow/notification schemes from the get-go and edit them from there on.
fields.summary: delegate admin tasks to the project level

fields.description:
The CSV Import Wizard does not work anymore with configuration files containing custome fields.
Every existing custom field is mapped to "None".

In the list of unmapped custom fields the name of the unmapped column appears wrong:

Unmapped CSV header
ActionexistingCustomField

(see also attachment).
There should be a blank or another Separator between "Action" (the column name)
and "existingCustomField" (the type of field).
Probably due to this missing separator the wizard cannot match the column name!

Using the same import configuration file just for doing an import shows no problem.
The data is imported correctly. Only the wizard does not work anymore, so if you have
to modify the import configuration you have to do this by editing the cfg file manually.
fields.summary: CSV Import Wizard does not work with custom fields anymore

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12087].
  {panel}

h4. Improvement Requests
* Include documentation identifying which RPC modules are required and which are optional
* Include workaround steps for the problem that occured below

h4.Scenario in which this would come in handy
A developer within our company wanted to try and create an xml-rpc client into JIRA.  He then asked the JIRA administrator to enable the RPC plugin.   At the time we were using JIRA 3.6.1 Professional, and had the RPC plugin disabled.  It was decided that we would enable this plugin during an upgrade to JIRA 3.7.2 Professional.

So after upgrading to JIRA 3.7.2 Professional (with all of our data now imported), we decided to turn on _"Accepting remote API Calls"_ and enable the RPC plugin according to the instructions available at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+XML-RPC+Client.  Not knowing what each individual module did, we decided to _disable the admin service module_ and left everything else enabled.  Screenshot shown in instructions doesn't show this module either, so thought it would be ok.  Also thought that , if anything went wrong we could just disable the entire plugin again.  However, after restarting services the {color:red}JIRA UI is no longer available.{color}  

To get our system backup we ultimately had to restore ms sql server 2000 from a clean database.  Then when the system was up, re-import all our data (which was unfortunate, since this process is very long).  It would be nice to know what the workaround for this would be, since it seems it could be manually changed in the database.   

h4.Additional Testing
Tested the same set of steps on the absolutely clean installation of JIRA 3.7.2.  Same issue is reproduced:
# Install 3.7.2
# Enable _"Accepting remote API Calls"_ and enable the RPC plugin 
# Disable Admin Service Module and leave all other modules enabled
# Restart Jira services
# Try connecting to http://localhost<port> : {color:red} UI no longer available{color}
fields.summary: [RPC JIRA Plugin] Documentation for which RPC modules are required and which are optional

fields.description:
Would like to have any user who emails in a task to jira to be copied on all activities of the ticket. We do not want to have the user added to the users database for this feature to work. IE: using the "createusers" option. The way we would like it to work is liek this.

Anonymous user emails jira an issue, it is created, a creation email is sent back to the sender. Then any comments to that ticket are also emailed back to the sender. This helps so that if a sender fails to supply enough information the ticket holder can make a comment requesting more infor, where the sender can reply to the email to fill in a new comment with the needed info.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Emailed tasks send copies to the person who sent in the email...
